intro: Chupalon pubescens, commonly known as the hairy chupalon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its hairy leaves and stems provide a distinctive appearance, while its pale yellow to orange flowers bloom in late summer. Chupalon pubescens is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
